questions.question: Which of the following is false about mental health?

options.A: Mental disorders are universal, not specific to any group
options.B: Mental health is the mere absence of mental illness
options.C: Heredity can contribute to mental illnesses
options.D: Substance abuse is a type of mental illness

questions.question: Which of the following are sociopathological factors associated with mental health?
questions.explanation: Economic insecurity, anxiety, and frustration are the sociopathological factors associated withmental health.The factors leading to mental health illnesses include:•· Organic - cerebral arteriosclerosis, neoplasms, endocrine, metabolic and chronic diseases• Hereditary - schizophrenia• Socio-pathological factors worries, anxiety, frustration, emotional stress, tension, unhappymarriages, broken homes, poverty, industrialization, urbanization, changing family structure,900population mobility, economic insecurity, cruelty, rejection, neglect.• Environmental - environmental toxins, substance abuse, radiation, nutritional factors, mineraldeficiencies, infectious diseases during prenatal, perinatal, and postnatal periods (like rubella),road traffic accidents.

questions.question: The incidence of mental illness is higher in individuals who are exposed to causal factorsduring which period of life?
questions.explanation: Exposure to causal factors during the initial 5 years of life leads to an increased incidence ofmental illness.This period is critical for lifelong mental health behavior and learning, even more crucialthan adolescence. During early childhood, the growth and development of children are mostvulnerable to external environmental stressors. A continuous, intimate, and warm relationshipwith the child's parents during infancy and childhood is very important.

questions.question: All of the following can be used for the secondary prevention of mental illness in patientsexcept:
questions.explanation: Improving the social environment is a method of primary prevention of mental illness, notsecondary prevention.The levels of prevention of mental illness and measures are given below:• Primary prevention - improving the social environment and the promotion of mental health•awarenessSecondary prevention - early diagnosis and family-based health services like casework and familycounseling•Tertiary prevention - measures to reduce the duration of mental illness as well family andcommunity stresses to prevent further breakdown and disruption

questions.question: Patients with which of the following conditions are considered to have a major mentalillness?
questions.explanation: Patients with manic depressive psychosis are considered to have a major mental illness.Mental health disorders are classified as:• Major (psychotic or not in touch with reality) - include schizophrenia, manic depressivepsychosis, and paranoia• Minor (non-psychotic, remain in touch with reality) - include neuroses (like OCD), personalityand character disordersDementia occurs secondary to organic causes.901

questions.question: Which of the following is not a service offered to patients with mental health disorders?
questions.explanation: Employment services are not included under mental health services.Mental health services include:••Early diagnosis and treatment⚫ Group and individual psychotherapy• Mental health education• Use of modern psychoactive drugs• Rehabilitation• After-care services - help drug-dependent persons to adapt to regular life following treatmentand rehabilitation

questions.question: A 32-year-old man is brought to the casualty with a suspected drug overdose. His sister tells you that he has recently started taking a 'superman drug' after hearing about it from his friends. What drug is she referring to?
questions.explanation: Amphetamines are also known as the 'superman drug'. This is because their effects include increased self-confidence and endurance. However, their usage leads to tolerance and dependence.

questions.question: What is the most widely used legal addictive substance in India?
questions.explanation: Tobacco is the most widely used legal addictive substance in India, followed closely by alcohol asthe second most widely consumed substance.

questions.question: Which of the following is not an objective of the National Mental Health Programme of 1982?

options.A: Ensure equal human rights to mentally ill
options.B: Promote community participation in mental health services
options.C: Promote application of mental health knowledge
options.D: Provide accessibility of mental health care

questions.explanation: Ensuring equal rights to mentally ill people is not an objective of the National Mental HealthProgramme (NMHP). It was launched in 1982 with the following objectives:•Ensure availability and accessibility of minimum mental health care• Encourage the application of mental health knowledge in general care• Promote community participation in mental health services developmentThe National Mental Health Programme was relaunched as The Mental Health Care Act, 2017which includes provisions for equal rights for those with mental illness.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a component of the District Mental Health Programme?
questions.explanation: Screening is not a component of the District Mental Health Programme. It includes the followingcomponents:•Training of all mental health workers at the nodal institute in the state• Increasing public awareness by education to reduce stigma• Early detection and treatment• Providing data for future planning, improvement in service and researchActivities by the DMHP for positive mental health include:• School mental health services•College counseling services• Workplace stress management• Suicide prevention services

questions.question: Which of the following is not included in the Mental Healthcare Act of 2017?

options.A: Advance directive rights of the mentally ill
options.D: Procedure for admission, treatment and discharge of the mentally ill

questions.explanation: Establishing mobile mental health camps for the benefit of mentally ill patients is not includedunder the Mental Healthcare Act of 2017.903This act encourages the mobilization of resources to improve mental health care across thecountry as well as reduce stigma and improve social inclusion/support for those with mentalillness. It also has provisions to improve outcomes and protect their rights.The provisions of this act include:•Rights of persons with mental illness to access health care, live without discrimination and enjoyconfidentiality.••• Advance directives to allow mentally ill people to make decisions about their treatmentProcedures for admission, treatment (behavioral and interpersonal therapy, medications), anddischarge• Decriminalizing suicide and prohibiting electroconvulsive therapy unless anesthesia is usedThe act also has clear instructions for the central and state mental health authorities and othermental health establishments on their endeavors.

questions.question: According to the WHO Mental Health Gap Action Programme, which of the following is notincluded in the Mental Health Care Act, 2017?
questions.explanation: According to the WHO Mental Health Gap Action Programme (mhGAP), screening of familymembers is not included in the Mental Health Care Act, 2017.The Mental Healthcare Act of 2017 has provisions that include:••Rights of persons with mental illness to access health care, live without discrimination and enjoyconfidentiality.••• Advance directives to allow mentally ill people to make decisions about their treatmentProcedures for admission, treatment (behavioral and interpersonal therapy, medications), anddischarge• Decriminalizing suicide and prohibiting electroconvulsive therapy unless anesthesia is usedThese are achieved through the mobilization of resources to required areas, and by providingsocial support.

questions.question: The National Suicide Prevention Strategy aims to reduce suicide mortality bycountry by 2030.
questions.explanation: The National Suicide Prevention Strategy (NSPS) aims to reduce suicide mortality by 10% in Indiaby 2030. It is a multisectoral approach that will involve national and international governmentministries, families, communities, and educational institutes to help prevent suicide.India has a high burden of suicide. It is the leading cause of death among individuals between15-29 years of age.Epidemiology• Young and middle-aged adults between 18-45 years• Males more than females904• Daily wage earners and people who earn <1,00,000 per annum• Individuals with family issues and illnessesHanging and poisoning were the most common methods of suicide. It accounts for >3/4th of allsuicides.Risk factors for suicide• Psychiatric illnesses- Depression, BPD, schizophrenia, and anxiety disorders• Alcohol and other substance abuse disorders•Major physical illnessJob or financial loss•Relationship or social loss•• Domestic violence or abuse• Lack of social support• The stigma associated with help-seeking behavior of mental disorders• Lack of social support and sense of isolation.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a component of the REDS path in the National suicideprevention strategy?

options.A: Reduce suicidal deaths by 2% in the next 5 years
options.B: Enhance health services to provide suicide prevention strategies
options.C: Develop community resilience, and societal support for suicide prevention

questions.explanation: The National Suicide Prevention Strategy (NSPS) is a multisectoral approach that will involvenational and international government ministries, families and communities, and educationalinstitutes. It aims to reduce suicide mortality by 10% in India by 2030.It recommends REDS path for suicide prevention.• Reinforce leadership, partnership, and institutional capacity in the country• Enhance the health services capacity to provide suicide prevention services•Develop community resilience, societal support for suicide prevention and reduce stigma againstsuicidal behaviours• Strengthen surveillance and evidence generation.ObjectivesTo establish effective surveillance mechanism for suicide prevention in next 3 years• To establish psychiatric OPDs that provide suicide prevention services through District MentalHealth Programme, within next 5 years.• To integrate mental well-being curriculum in all educational institutes within next 8 years.905
